cluster_relations.rel_desc: The strike by pyramid workers took place in ancient Egypt.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Pyramid Construction and Labor Strike (Ancient Egypt)

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Egyptian pyramids are situated in ancient Egypt.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Pyramid Construction and Labor Strike (Ancient Egypt)

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The initial protests took place in Tunisia.
The Arab Spring spread across the Middle East and North Africa region.
remarks: MENA entity used to capture combined regional reference.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Arab Spring took place in North Africa.

args.canonical_rel_desc: An event or process takes place within a specified geographic, political, or administrative region.
args.justification: All four relations link an event or episode (strike, protests, Arab Spring) to the region where it took place, matching an event-oriented spatial predicate 'occurs_in'.

args.canonical_rel_desc: An entity or object is geographically or spatially situated within a specified place or region.
args.justification: This relation connects a physical entity (Egyptian pyramids) to the broader region (ancient Egypt) where it is situated, which is better modeled as a generic spatial containment predicate 'located_in' rather than an event-occurrence relation.

All relations express spatial placement of an event or entity with respect to a geographic or regional entity, so they belong to the same broader class of spatial location relations even though the specific predicates differ (occurs_in vs located_in).
Each relation encodes a spatial relationship between subject and object (events or entities situated in regions), fitting the broad semantic dimension of spatiality.

executed_decisions.justification: All four relations link an event or episode (strike, protests, Arab Spring) to the region where it took place, matching an event-oriented spatial predicate 'occurs_in'.

All relations express spatial placement of an event or entity with respect to a geographic or regional entity, so they belong to the same broader class of spatial location relations even though the specific predicates differ (occurs_in vs located_in).
Each relation encodes a spatial relationship between subject and object (events or entities situated in regions), fitting the broad semantic dimension of spatiality.
